page.title: 15WORSTON MILL RESTAURANT
page.content: Worston Mill is a popular place for socialising. Up to 50 people a night eat in the restaurant in the summer. Many more just come to drink and maybe have a meal at the bar. The bar is open in accordance with the licensing laws 11am to 2.30 or 3pm and 6pm to 11pm on weekdays, and from 12 to 2pm, and 7pm to 10.30pm on Sundays. About 500 gallons of beer are consumed in a week. It sells at 70p a pint. Lager is also popular, and Cinzano and Martini for the ladies. More people are drinking wine though there is also a trend towards soft drinks because of the drink/driving laws. Of the bar meals scampi and chips at Â£3.50 is very much liked. People can sit outside, two of the tables are converted mill-wheels. There are swings and slides for the children.
